value.name: FBI Arrests 3 Men Linked to Violent White Supremacist Group Ahead of Pro-Gun Rally
value.description: (COLLEGE PARK, Md.) — FBI agents on Thursday arrested a former Canadian Armed Forces reservist and two other men who are linked to a violent white supremacist group and were believed to be heading to a pro-gun rally next week in Virginia’s capital. The three men are members of The Base and were arrested on federal charges in a criminal ...

value.name: Grammy Awards chief Deborah Dugan placed on leave 10 days before ceremony
value.description: LOS ANGELES — The head of the organization behind the Grammy Awards was placed on leave Thursday, 10 days before the 62nd edition of the ceremony. Deborah Dugan, who took the helm of the Recording Academy in August, was placed on administrative leave after "a formal allegation of misconduct by a senior female member" of the organization, the ...

value.name: 'The massacred them." 7 killed, 14 tortured in exorcism ritual in Panama jungle
value.description: PANAMA CITY — Seven people were killed in a bizarre religious ritual in a jungle community in Panama, in which indigenous residents were rounded up by about 10 lay preachers and tortured, beaten, burned and hacked with machetes to make them "repent their sins," authorities said Thursday. Police freed 14 members of the Ngabé Buglé indigenous ...

value.name: What tariffs? Americans still willing to spend — for now, at least
value.description: The newest reading on consumer sentiment from the University of Michigan’s Surveys of Consumers shows that Americans are feeling pretty upbeat these days. Two new metrics on consumer holiday-season spending published this week found that consumer spending held up through the all-important holiday season: The National Retail Federation said ...

value.name: JC Penney Layoffs: Retailer To Cut 243 Jobs, Close Call Center
value.description: JC Penney (JCP) is reportedly eliminating 243 jobs at its Lenexa, Kansas, Logistics Center, which the company plans on closing. The retailer filed a WARN notice with the state on Thursday, which did not specify when the layoffs would occur. JC Penney told KSHB, an NBC affiliate out of Kansas City, Missouri, in a statement that “To centralize ...

value.name: Weekend winter storm will make travel 'hazardous' across central US and the Northeast
value.description: Snow will fall Friday in the Dakotas, Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan. Ice will be the story from the central Plains to the Ohio Valley. By Saturday, heavy snow is expected in portions of Pennsylvania, New York and much of New England. A winter storm will dump snow and ice across a wide swath of the northern U.S. on Friday and into the ...

value.name: SamTrans accused of playing 'musical chairs' with homeless, busing them to San Francisco and abandoning them
value.description: The blame game is in full swing in the Bay Area following allegations that counties are playing "musical chairs" with their homeless population - using resources to shuttle transients, drug addicts and the mentally ill to San Francisco and abandoning them. San Mateo County's newly-expanded SamTrans bus service starts at the Peninsula and ends ...

value.name: A truck carrying 1,738 piglets overturned in Iowa
value.description: (CNN)A truck full of piglets overturned on an Iowa interstate Thursday, slowing rush-hour traffic while authorities cleared the wreck and rounded up scurrying swine. The semi carrying 1,738 pigs was traveling on I-35 East in Des Moines when it tipped over on an off ramp. "He was traveling just a little too fast for that ramp," Iowa State Patrol ...

value.name: Who is Russia's new prime minister, Mikhail Mishustin?
value.description: Moscow ­­­— Few knew the name Mikhail Mishustin until this week, when President Vladimir Putin appointed him Russia's new prime minister. Now he's the second most powerful politician in the country, replacing Russia's longest-serving prime minister, Dmitry Medvedev, who resigned shortly after Putin proposed sweeping constitutional changes.
